item.title: Manda add a quote by Maxine Kumin
item.description: "Cherish your wilderness." -- Maxine Kumin

item.title: Manda add a quote by Lucille Clifton
item.description: "may you kiss the wind then turn from it certain that it will love your back" -- Lucille Clifton

item.title: Manda add a quote by Vanessa Kelly
item.description:
"Aden St. George managed to avoid having to kill the guard stationed outside his quarry’s crypt-like cell, although the thug outside the caves hadn’t been so lucky. Still, that bastard had tried to knife him in the gut so Aden could hardly be faulted for returning the favor. And knowing what he did about the men who’d kidnapped Lady Vivien Shaw, he wouldn’t waste his fitful conscience on that brutal but necessary act. Killing was not a favorite pastime, but only rarely did it disturb his sleep.
Tonight’s rescue mission carried no inconvenient opportunities for remorse since a woman’s life and innocence hung in the balance. True, the gossips whispered that Lady Vivien’s innocence was an open question, but what would happen to her if Aden failed wasn’t. Without his intervention she would disappear into a nightmarish life, forever beyond the protection of her family and friends." -- Vanessa Kelly

item.title: Manda add a quote by Vanessa Kelly
item.description:
"Linnet’s thudding heart raced blood through her veins, sending a flush of embarrassing heat to her face. She had been avoiding him, but she could never tell him why. It took all her discipline not to quail under Sir Anthony’s penetrating gaze.
Blast the man. She’d lost count of the times he’d made her feel like a blushing maiden. Strictly speaking, she was still a maiden, but she’d given up blushing years ago—along with simpering, flirting, and so many other talents deemed useful to unmarried women.
Except, of course, in Sir Anthony’s august presence." -- Vanessa Kelly

item.title: Manda add a quote by Simone St. James
item.description: "You can't imagine how hard it is to come home from hell and be expected to pick up the threads of a life. Apply for jobs, go to a factory, punch in, punch out. Put your lunch in a bag and get on the omnibus every day. Like nothing happened." -- Simone St. James

item.title: Manda add a quote by Tessa Dare
item.description: "Dedication: For librarians and booksellers everywhere, who gather books and build shelters for tender souls." -- Tessa Dare

item.title: Manda add a quote by Michael Palin
item.description: "You can't get a suit of armour and a rubber chicken just like that. You have to plan ahead." -- Michael Palin

item.title: Manda add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Manda add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin, or his background, or his religion. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love, for love comes more naturally to the human heart than its opposite." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Manda add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "One day in the country Is worth a month in town" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Manda add a quote by Anthony Powell
item.description: "I get a warm feeling among my books." -- Anthony Powell

item.title: Manda add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They’re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: Manda add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Like all of my friends, she's a lousy judge of character." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Manda add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "The salvation of this human world lies nowhere else than in the human heart, in the human power to reflect, in human meekness and human responsibility." -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: Manda add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "Of all sound of all bells... most solemn and touching is the peal which rings out the Old Year." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Manda add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Manda add a quote by Elizabeth Strout
item.description: "I suspect the most we can hope for, and it's no small hope, is that we never give up, that we never stop giving ourselves permission to try to love and receive love." -- Elizabeth Strout

item.title: Manda add a quote by Mark Frost
item.description: "We have two families in life. One were born with that shares our blood. Another we meet along the way that's willing to give it's life for us." -- Mark Frost

item.title: Manda add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Manda add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "These are the times that try men's souls." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Manda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Manda add a quote by Anchee Min
item.description: "The sun doesn't just hang on one family's tree" -- Anchee Min

item.title: Manda add a quote by Anne Brontë
item.description: "It is better to arm and strengthen your hero, than to disarm and enfeeble your foe." -- Anne Brontë

item.title: Manda add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Manda add a quote by Colette
item.description: "I went to collect the few personal belongings which...I held to be invaluable: my cat, my resolve to travel, and my solitude." -- Colette

item.title: Manda add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Manda add a quote by Shirley Hazzard
item.description: "Poetry has been the longest pleasure of my life." -- Shirley Hazzard

item.title: Manda add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Manda add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "A little Madness in the Spring Is wholesome even for the King." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Manda add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Reading was my escape and my comfort, my consolation, my stimulant of choice: reading for the pure pleasure of it, for the beautiful stillness that surrounds you when you hear an author's words reverberating in your head." -- Paul Auster
